badge_template_activities.title: Must be an Employee of CQUniversity

Earners of this award are within the first five years of academic or other research related employment, demonstrating a leadership role in establishing research relationships with external stakeholders and within research teams, bringing together researchers from other national universities, or;

Are between five and 10 years research experience since the award of their Doctor of Philosophy (PhD) and are able to demonstrate that they are recognised nationally as being influential in expanding the knowledge of their discipline area, and have made significant and original contributions to research, which have had a significant impact on their field of expertise.

They will have an understanding of the profound implications of healthy ageing, what elder abuse encompasses, and the importance of sexuality in the older population. They can identify key concepts in health care communication, strategies to begin end of life conversation, the influence and purpose of aggressive behaviour and principles of reflective writing.
0e68df12-9843-4efd-a6d2-fc44e9cac637.name: Providing Quality Aged Care

3a463347-008c-4abb-8cb5-f6b60cbd3780.description: Earners will have a clear understanding of their Scope of Practice as a fitness professional in the wider context of the health industry. b1c1a7e6-7c94-4a7f-b4f4-7b4aed515351.description: Earners will have an understanding of the concept of success being accompanied by failure, and that successful business leaders are those who have said to fail more than others. They have examined why mistakes and failures are a critical part of contemporary leadership.

387bdadc-1dc9-46fa-ab74-a6ab686ef02a.description: Learners explored how strengths, values, and goals relate to happiness and wellbeing.
